question_text: Figure 20 shows the structure of a molecule of tetrafluoroethene. Tetrafluoroethene can form the polymer poly(tetrafluoroethene). Draw a diagram to show the structure of the repeating unit of this polymer.
subject: Chemistry

question_text: Poly(tetrafluoroethene) is also known as Teflon TM. State one use of poly(tetrafluoroethene) and explain how one of its properties makes it suitable for that use.
subject: Chemistry
